Yaiba-0.2.2: Implementation of Buchberger's algorithmsSource codeContentsIndex
Yaiba.Polynomial
Description
A Poly is synonymous to a map from Mon lists to a rational number
Synopsis
newtype PolySug ord = PS (Poly ord, Sugar ord)
deleteFindMin :: Ord (Mon ord) => Set (PolySug ord) -> ((Poly ord, Sugar ord), Set (PolySug ord))
newtype Poly ord = P (Map (Mon ord) Field)
showTerm :: [(Mon ord, Field)] -> String

isNull :: Poly ord -> Bool
prune :: Ord (Mon ord) => Poly ord -> Poly ord

leadTerm :: Poly ord -> (Mon ord, Field)
deleteFindLT :: Poly ord -> ((Mon ord, Field), Poly ord)
numTerms :: Poly ord -> Int
quoRem :: Ord (Mon ord) => (Poly ord, Sugar ord) -> (Poly ord, Sugar ord) -> (Poly ord, Poly ord, Sugar ord)
Documentation
newtype PolySug ord Source
PolySug is a type that stores a polynomial, together with its sugar.
Constructors
PS (Poly ord, Sugar ord)
Instances
Ord (Mon ord) => Eq (PolySug ord)
Ord (Mon ord) => Ord (PolySug ord)
deleteFindMin :: Ord (Mon ord) => Set (PolySug ord) -> ((Poly ord, Sugar ord), Set (PolySug ord))Source
newtype Poly ord Source
Poly is the type of a polynomial. Currently, these are represented as a Map from Monomials to Field where Field is a type that can be chosen at compile time between [;F_2;], a finite field, or Q (in Base.hs)
Constructors
P (Map (Mon ord) Field)
Instances
Ord (Mon ord) => Eq (Poly ord)
Ord (Mon ord) => Num (Poly ord)
Ord (Mon ord) => Ord (Poly ord)
Ord (Mon ord) => Show (Poly ord)
NFData (Poly ord)
showTerm :: [(Mon ord, Field)] -> StringSource
fromList :: Ord (Mon ord) => [(Mon ord, Field)] -> Poly ordSource
isNull :: Poly ord -> BoolSource
prune :: Ord (Mon ord) => Poly ord -> Poly ordSource
Removes elements that point to the zero element of the field.
getMap :: Poly ord -> Map (Mon ord) FieldSource
leadTerm :: Poly ord -> (Mon ord, Field)Source
Returns a tuple of the lead term Mon list and its coefficient.
deleteFindLT :: Poly ord -> ((Mon ord, Field), Poly ord)Source

Just returns the lead term Mon list.

The degree of the poly.

Returns a tuple of the lead term as Poly and the rest of the supplied Poly.

numTerms :: Poly ord -> IntSource
The length of the poly
quoRem :: Ord (Mon ord) => (Poly ord, Sugar ord) -> (Poly ord, Sugar ord) -> (Poly ord, Poly ord, Sugar ord)Source

Just adds a monomial without turning it into a polynomial first

Scales every term of a Polynomial by a Mon list and rational number.

Divides the first polynomial by the second repeatedly until it fails. Keeps track of the sugar throughout the reduction
